10 Sets

10.1 Set

Construct sets using sets.set(lst). Sets have the type sets.Set.

In Captain Teach and in #lang pyret/whalesong, set and Set are in the environment by default, so you can just use their names as identifiers.

data Set: | ... end

set

fun set(lst :: List):  end

Construct a set from a list.

Set.member()

method(self, elem :: Any) -> Bool:

  doc: "Check to see if an element is in a set."

  

end

Set.add()

method(self, elem :: Any) -> Set:

  doc: "Add an element to the set if it is not already present."

  

end

Set.remove()

method(self, elem :: Any) -> Set:

  doc: "Remove an element from the set if it is present."

  

end

Set.to-list()

method(self) -> List:

  doc: "Convert a set into a sorted list of elements."

  

end

Set.union()

method(self :: Set, other :: Set) -> Set:

  doc: "Compute the union of this set and another set."

  

end

Set.intersect()

method(self :: Set, other :: Set) -> Set:

  doc: "Compute the intersection of this set and another set."

  

end

Set.difference()

method(self :: Set, other :: Set) -> Set:

  doc: "Compute the difference of this set and another set."

  

end
